intro: Calcearia calcicola, commonly known as the limestone sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and delicate white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils, particularly those rich in calcium carbonate, which is reflected in its scientific name. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Calcearia calcicola plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
